resources.string: An automatic earthquake location that has not been reviewed by a duty officer or analyst.
Oops! This was not a real earthquake and has been deleted.
This earthquake location is a duplicate of another one.
This earthquake has been reviewed and confirmed by a duty officer or analyst.
We don\'t know what this status means! :(
Notifications and highlighting for quakes above magnitude: %s
Checking for new quakes every %s minutes
Checking for new quakes every %s hours
Will only notify you about quakes that have been reviewed by a Geonet staff member.

What's Shaking, NZ? uses the Geonet.org.nz data feed to provide you with up to date information about the latest earthquakes around New Zealand. 

Please tweet (@WhatsShakingNZ) or email (android-support@speakman.net.nz) me with any problems you find or suggestions for features you'd like to see in the next version. 

What's Shaking, NZ? is an open source application. You can find the source code on Github at:
https://github.com/adamsp/wsnz-android 

For news and more information, check out the What's Shaking, NZ? website:
www.whatsshaking.co.nz

- Fixed the background check service crashing when no internet connection is available
 - Fixed application crashing if it receives data from Geonet in an unexpected format
 - Fixed possible crash for alternate locale number formats
 - Changed default map zoom level for devices with high resolution screens
 - Added a 'status' value to quakes - this indicates whether the quake has been reviewed by a human, or has been automatically calculated by the computer. Reviewed quakes are reliable, automatic ones are not.
